subject: Relationships
title: Defining Toxic: More Than Just Bad Days
description: A micro-lesson that makes Defining Toxic: More Than Just Bad Days usable.

hook.text: Every relationship has bad days. But some relationships have a pattern that slowly destroys you from inside.

buildup.text: Psychologists define toxic relationships by recurring patterns of control, disrespect, and emotional harm.

discovery.text: The key distinction: in healthy conflict, both partners grow. In toxic patterns, one person consistently diminishes.

twist.text: Toxic relationships often look perfect from outside. The abuse is subtle â€” invisible to everyone except the victim.

climax.text: A relationship isn't toxic because of one fight. It's toxic when the pattern repeats and repair never happens.

punchline.text: Toxic isn't one bad day. It's a pattern that never gets repaired.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a toxic relationship from normal conflict?
options: Recurring patterns of control and harm without repair
